title: yum and apt
lessonContent:
Ah, the Batmans of package management, these systems come with all the fixins to make package installation, removal and changes easier, including installing package dependencies. Two of the most popular management systems is yum and apt. Yum is exclusive to the Red Hat family and apt is exclusively to the Debian family. Install a package from a repository 
Debian: $ apt install package_name
RPM: $ yum install package_name
Remove a package 
Debian: $ apt remove package_name
RPM: $ yum erase package_name
Updating packages for a repository It's always best practice to update your package repositories so they are up to date before you install and update a package. 
Debian: apt update; apt upgrade
RPM: yum update
Get information about an installed package 
Debian: apt show package_name
RPM: yum info package_name
exercise: Run through each of these package commands and see the output you receive.
